TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobileTextWriter extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides the base class for all objects used for rendering ASP.NET mobile controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class and its inherited classes provide services and helper methods for adapters to perform rendering.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .
Docs.related: Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior
Adapter Sets Functionality
Mobile Text Writer Rendering Best Practices

remarks.format: ## Remarks The page adapter must call this method before rendering the page, but after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginResponse%2A> method. An exception is raised if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginFile%2A> method is called more than once.

Docs.exception: this method is called more than once.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void WriteEncodedUrl (string url);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteEncodedUrl(string url) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub WriteEncodedUrl (url As String)
public: virtual void WriteEncodedUrl(System::String ^ url);
abstract member WriteEncodedUrl : string -> unit override this.WriteEncodedUrl : string -> unit

Docs.param: The URL string.
Docs.summary: Writes the given URL, encoding it correctly for the target device. The URL might include parameters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The URL is translated in accordance with the specification for URL encoding. For example, spaces in the main part of the URL are translated into %20, spaces in the parameter part of the URL are translated into plus (+) signs, the '/' character is translated into %2f, and so forth.
Derived writer classes can override this method.

Docs.related: Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior
Adapter Sets Functionality

Docs.param: The URL string.
Docs.summary: Writes the given URL parameter text, encoding it correctly for the target device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Inherited writer classes can override this method.

Docs.related: Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior
Adapter Sets Functionality

MemberSignature.Value: protected void WriteUrlEncodedString (string s, bool argument);
.method familyhidebysig instance void WriteUrlEncodedString(string s, bool argument) cil managed
Protected Sub WriteUrlEncodedString (s As String, argument As Boolean)
protected: void WriteUrlEncodedString(System::String ^ s, bool argument);
member this.WriteUrlEncodedString : string * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The string to be added.
If argument is , the encoding is done as if the string were a part of the URL parameters. If argument is , the encoding is done as if the string were part of the path portion of the URL.
Docs.summary: Writes the given string, encoding it according to URL requirements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.WriteEncodedUrl(System.String)> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.WriteEncodedUrlParameter(System.String)> methods use this method as a utility method.

Docs.related: Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior
Adapter Sets Functionality
